alert.note: Alert for Linn (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 7:27PM CDT until June 05 at 5:13AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following counties, Johnson KS, Linn KS and Miami. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 727 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Overland Park, Leawood, Paola, Spring Hill, Osawatomie, Louisburg, La Cygne, Linn Valley, Parker, Fontana, New Lancaster, Beagle, Hillsdale, Wagstaff, Chiles, Bucyrus and Stillwell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
